intro: Cynoglossum macranthum, commonly known as the large-flowered hound's tongue, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its hairy stems and medicinal properties. Cynoglossum macranthum typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
